Module com.example.dmscoursework
Package com.example.dmscoursework.View.Brick

Class Brick

java.lang.Object
com.example.dmscoursework.View.Brick.Brick
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlueBrick, CementBrick, CheckerBlueBrick, CheckerOrangeBrick, CheckerPinkBrick, ClayBrick, OrangeBrick, PinkBrick, SteelBrick, StripeBlueBrick, StripeOrangeBrick, StripePinkBrick
public abstract class Brick extends Object
The Brick class is an abstract class which contains all the relevant information that a brick may need such as shape, strength, broken as well as the ability to generate a Crack.
Since:
04-01-2022
Version:
1.0
Author:
William Michiel Simson van Dijkhuizen

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    Brick.Crack
    A Crack is a line that runs down the brick in order to show that it has been impacted and that it is nearly broken.

  • Constructor Details

    • Brick

      public Brick(javafx.geometry.Point2D pos, javafx.geometry.Dimension2D size, int strength)
      Constructs a Brick whose upper-left corner is specified by the Point2D argument. The width and height are specified by the Dimension2D argument The number of hits to break the Brick specified by an int argument.
      Parameters:
      pos - a Point that is the upper-left corner of the Brick.
      size - a Dimension, representing width and height of the Brick.
      strength - an integer, which is number of impacts before breaking.

  • Method Details

      Returns:
      a Shape, which is shape of the brick.

    • IsM_NotBroken

      public boolean IsM_NotBroken()
      Gets if a brick is broken.
      Returns:
      a boolean, which is whether brick is broken or not.

    • FindImpact

      public int FindImpact(Ball b)
      Find where the ball impacted the brick.
      Parameters:
      b - The ball
      Returns:
      an integer, where brick was impacted.

    • IsImpacted

      public boolean IsImpacted(Ball b)
      Check if a brick was impacted by the ball.
      Parameters:
      b - a Ball
      Returns:
      a boolean, which is whether the brick was hit or not.

    • SetImpact

      public boolean SetImpact(javafx.geometry.Point2D point, int dir)
      setImpact takes a Point2D argument which is the coordinates of a point on the ball e.g. the TOP, BOTTOM, LEFT or RIGHT of the ball. The direction is specifying the direction the brick needs to crack.
      Parameters:
      point - a Point2D, coordinate of the ball that collided with brick.
      dir - an integer, direction in which brick needs to crack.
      Returns:
      a boolean, whether ball impacted or not.

    • Repair

      public void Repair()
      Repairs the brick, so that is not broken and at full strength
